heisig_chinese_memo: In the days of the vikings handsome heads had to have a big nose and a helmet with horns.
heisig_constituent: neck, horns, nose, one, ceiling, drop, eye
heisig_story: Reading this kanji from the top down, we have: horns . . . nose. Together they bring to mind the picture of a moose-head hanging on the den wall, with its great horns and long nose. Now while we would speak of cutting off a moose's "head" to hang on the wall, the Japanese speak of cutting off its neck. It's all a matter of how you look at it. Anyway, if you let the word neck conjure up the image of a moose with a very l-o-n-g neck hanging over the fireplace, whose horns you use for a coat-rack and whose nose has spigots left and right for scotch and water, you should have no trouble with the character. Here we get a good look at what we mentioned when we first introduced the element for horns: that they can never be left floating free and require an extra horizontal stroke to prevent that from happening, as is the case here.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: neck, counter for songs and poems
koohiiStory1: The V shape is your neck on top of your collar bone, or the straight line. Yourself, or the rest of your body is below that!
koohiiStory2: The mooses neck supports it¬¥s big horns and long nose.

humanum_full_description_en:
The shape of a human head on the side of the oracle bone character image, with a head on it, or the hair can be omitted. Although the golden inscription is also a pictogram of the head, the parts under the long hair are sometimes dominated by eyes (eyes) and sometimes by nose (self). The characters of the Warring States Period have both with and without hair, but some of the " first " characters have the hair written as " stop ". "Wen said," breakdown " ¶£ª ", " first " word, and " first mentioned under" word: "First, ¶£ª with classical ¶£ª also like Chuan Fa, called Shun, Shun Chuan also where calipering. The genus of ©†ê is from ©†ê.‚Äù It can be seen that " ¶£ª " is the small seal in " Suo Wen", and the " first " is the ancient prose. Seen from the above, " ¶£ª " bearing no hair glyph from, " first " commitment have made the font from.

The word " shou " oracle bone inscription is used as the original meaning. For example, "Compilation" 24956: "Wang Jishou." It means that Wang's head is sick. The term "shoushou" is frequently seen in the handed down documents, such as "Mencius": "Climbing the head of the disease and telling each other", Zhao Qi's note: "The head of the disease, the headache." The word " shou " can also be used as a name.

The word " first " in bronze is used as the original meaning. For example, the white plate of Guo Jizi: "Five hundred for the first time" means that five hundred heads are cut off. It can also be used as " hand ", such as ÈÅπÁ∞ã: "Waiting the first (hand) first", other inscriptions are mostly "Waiting the first", handed down documents such as "Shang Shu. Zhou Shu. "Zhaogao" is called "Beishou Jishou". "Bai Shou Ji Shou" is the ancient ritual of kneeling, that is, bowing to hands and bowing to the ground.

" Home " is the most important part of the human body, and therefore " first " and on behalf of that person or thing in the center, such as the head of the princes, the capital. In addition, " first " is at the uppermost part of the human body, so it also means first, beginning, etc., such as first, first, etc. "Guang Ya": "The first, the beginning."
